intro: Martiella, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has strap-like leaves that are grassy in appearance. Martiella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
